Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2014 11:16AM Swegirl wrote: hi there, looks like we are in the same boat. I'm 36, no family history and had a baseline done this spring. Found a small lump this past week that sent me in for a level 2 mammo and the lump was fine but they found microcalcs. Just like yours. I had a biopsy yesterday..... So now I'm waiting!

Posts.Title: October.... The cosmic joke Swegirl Hopeful82014

Posts.Content: Swegirl wrote: so here I am trying to keep my mind off the pending biopsy.... And it is October 1st. Breast cancer awareness month ( yeah I'm pretty aware at this point) , and I see pink sh!t everywhere. I mean pink port-a-potties and pink dumpsters...... I feel like I'm stuck in some twisted cosmic joke...... I am sorry if I'm offending someone with not feeling like the pink overload is great right now, I get that it is awareness and research ones etc  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: October.... The cosmic joke Swegirl Hopeful82014

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2014 09:06AM Swegirl wrote: Dear Whatnow, I absolutely see your Point. I Think what I was trying to get across in my original post was that when you are like me stuck in the WHAT IF panic and have been told to Think of other things and keep your mind and body busy it feels somewhat like a cosmic slap in the face that everywhere I turn I see Pink and Ribbons....
Posts.Title: October.... The cosmic joke Swegirl Hopeful82014
